pull.title: test_framework: detect failure of bitcoind startup
pull.body:
Replace the `bitcoin-cli -rpcwait` after spawning bitcoind with our own loop that detects when bitcoind exits prematurely (before RPC is up).

This prevents a hang in such a case (see #7463).

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

issue.title: salvagewallet fails verification
issue.body:
This is somewhat rare but still worth to take a look sometime. I can reproduce locally and [travis complains](https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/106719585) in `wallet.py`:

```
check -salvagewallet

start_node: bitcoind started, calling bitcoin-cli -rpcwait getblockcount

No output has been received in the last 10 minutes, this potentially indicates a stalled build or something wrong with the build itself.

The build has been terminated
```

---

Edit:

This will now show up as

```
check -salvagewallet
Unexpected exception caught during testing: Exception('bitcoind exited with status 1 during initialization',)
```

issue.title: test: wallet reindex test has a race
issue.body:
It doesn't actually wait for the reindex to complete - so sometimes one gets this error, where there's no balance yet:

```
check -reindex
Assertion failed: [Decimal('33.99911100'), Decimal('5649.99796160'), Decimal('59.99974800')] != [Decimal('33.99911100'), Decimal('5649.99796160'), Decimal('0E-8')]
  File "/data/src/bitcoin/qa/rpc-tests/test_framework/test_framework.py", line 135, in main
    self.run_test()
  File "./wallet.py", line 296, in run_test
    assert_equal(balance_nodes, [self.nodes[i].getbalance() for i in range(3)])
  File "/data/src/bitcoin/qa/rpc-tests/test_framework/util.py", line 428, in assert_equal
    raise AssertionError("%s != %s"%(str(thing1),str(thing2)))
Stopping nodes
Cleaning up
Failed
```

The error is kind of rare as reindexing of the regtest chain is very fast.
It does seem to happen more after #7744, as it has less delay in the startup.

events.body:
Not ready to merge yet. I've tested this with a -salvagewallet loop:

```
Unexpected exception caught during testing: bitcoind exited with status 1 during initialization
  File "/data/src/bitcoin/qa/rpc-tests/test_framework/test_framework.py", line 135, in main
    self.run_test()
  File "./wallet.py", line 295, in run_test
    self.nodes = start_nodes(3, self.options.tmpdir, [[m]] * 3)
  File "/data/src/bitcoin/qa/rpc-tests/test_framework/util.py", line 283, in start_nodes
    return [ start_node(i, dirname, extra_args[i], rpchost, binary=binary[i]) for i in range(num_nodes) ]
  File "/data/src/bitcoin/qa/rpc-tests/test_framework/util.py", line 267, in start_node
    wait_for_bitcoind_start(bitcoind_processes[i], url, i)
  File "/data/src/bitcoin/qa/rpc-tests/test_framework/util.py", line 144, in wait_for_bitcoind_start
    raise Exception('bitcoind exited with status %i during initialization' % process.returncode)
Stopping nodes
```

Even though reporting is better, it still hangs after "Stopping nodes", going to investigate why.

Should be fixed now. The problem was that start_nodes can fail with part of the nodes already started.
`wait_bitcoinds` will subsequently wait forever for them to exit (as it uses a global variable to communicate bitcoind_processes).
One-to-last commit makes sure that they're stopped properly in that case.

events.message:
test_framework: detect failure of bitcoind startup

Replace the `bitcoin-cli -rpcwait` after spawning bitcoind
with our own loop that detects when bitcoind exits prematurely.

And if one node fails to start, stop the others.

This prevents a hang in such a case (see #7463).

events.body:
~~This is faster than the current -rpcwait construction, so #7745 triggers more, seems I need to solve that too here.~~
Thanks Marco Falke for fixing this already.

issue.title: cherry-pick Core PR#7744 to fail wallet.py test instead of freezing up
issue.body:
This is a merge of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7744 .

Instead of freezing up qa tests, wallet.py will now be failed on the 32-bit platforms where wallet salvage operation sometimes fails due to unknown reasons.

See also: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/7463 about the `-salvagewallet` problem.

Upstream has decided to disable the salvage part of the test in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8038 , we may implement a Skip() of this test on 32-bit or disable that test step in a similar way.

issue.title: wallet.py freezes qa tests in salvage operation on a 32 bit test platform
issue.body:
This is basically identical to what was reported in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/7463 .
It happens reproducibly on a certain 32-bit test platform running Debian 7 and Berkeley DB 4.8.30.

Due to a test framework inadequacy, this hangs the test run.
This test framework problem is fixed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7744/commits/018b60c5ea703ed12edcde034a185f79e77e5576 , which will be cherry-picked here so that the wallet.py test at least fails when this problem occurs.

issue.title: cherry-pick Core PR#7744 to abort test instead of freezing up
issue.body:
This is a merge of bitcoin/bitcoin#7744 / MVF-Core PR#16.

Instead of freezing up qa tests, wallet.py will fail on some 32-bit platforms where wallet salvage operation sometimes fails due to unknown reasons.

See also: bitcoin/bitcoin#7463 about the -salvagewallet problem.

Core has decided to disable the salvage part of the test in bitcoin/bitcoin#8038 , we may implement a Skip() of this test on 32-bit or disable that test step in a similar way.
The wallet salvage problem is definitely unrelated to any fork programming.

issue.title: Python 3 for qa
issue.body:
Switch to Python 3 for qa tests. 

All tests pass, except for pruning. It does not look like the pruning error is related to this, I created a seperate issue for it https://github.com/bitcoinxt/bitcoinxt/issues/256.

Contains the following ports:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7744 - test_framework: detect failure of bitcoind startup
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7751 - test_framework: python3.4 authproxy compat
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7814 - [qa] Switch to py3
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7853 - [qa] py2: Unfiddle strings into bytes explicitly
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8066 - [qa] test_framework: Use different rpc_auth_pair for each node
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8139 - Fix interrupted HTTP RPC connection workaround for Python 3.5+
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8400 - [qa]: enable rpcbind_test
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8839 - test: Avoid ConnectionResetErrors during RPC tests

issue.title: Backport RPC test harness PRs
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6548
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6804
  - Just the coverage backend, not the flag to enable it for all RPC tests.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7744
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9832
  - Excludes `wallet-hd.py` change (missing bitcoin/bitcoin#8309).

Part of #2074.

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: S-scratching-an-itch
labels.description: Status: Something we haven't planned for a sprint but are doing anyway

     """
     if extra_args is None: extra_args = [ None for i in range(num_nodes) ]
     if binary is None: binary = [ None for i in range(num_nodes) ]
-    return [ start_node(i, dirname, extra_args[i], rpchost, binary=binary[i]) for i in range(num_nodes) ]
+    rpcs = []
+    try:
+        for i in range(num_nodes):
+            rpcs.append(start_node(i, dirname, extra_args[i], rpchost, binary=binary[i]))
+    except: # If one node failed to start, stop the others

     return datadir
